sen.j: 浦上 村宗（うらがみ むらむね、生年不詳 - 享禄4年（1531年）6月）は備前国・美作国・播磨国の戦国大名。
sen.e: Muramune URAGAMI (year of birth is unknown - June, 1531) was the daimyo (the Japanese territorial lord) during the Sengoku period in Bizen, Mimasaka, and Harima Provinces.
Muramune URAGAMI (year of birth is unknown - June, 1531) was the daimyo (the Japanese territorial lord) during the Sengoku period in Bizen, Mimasaka, and Harima Provinces.
Muramune URAGAMI (year of birth is unknown - June, 1531) was the daimyo (the Japanese territorial lord) during the Sengoku period in Bizen, Mimasaka, and Harima Provinces.

sen.j: 浦上宗助の子（則宗の実子とする家系図も）。
sen.e: He was a son of Munesuke URAGAMI (there is also a family tree indicating that Muramune was Norimune's biological child).
He was a son of Munesuke URAGAMI (there is also a family tree indicating that Muramune was Norimune's biological child).
He was a son of Munesuke URAGAMI (there is also a family tree indicating that Muramune was Norimune's biological child).

sen.j: 弟に浦上宗久。
sen.e: Sokyu URAGAMI was his brother.
Sokyu URAGAMI was his younger brother.
Sokyu URAGAMI was his younger brother.

sen.j: 子に浦上政宗、浦上宗景。
sen.e: Masamune URAGAMI and Munekage URAGAMI were his sons.
Masamune URAGAMI and Munekage URAGAMI were his sons.
Masamune URAGAMI and Munekage URAGAMI were his sons.

sen.j: 掃部助。
sen.e: Kamon no suke (Assistant Director of the House Repair and the Cleaning Office)
He was Kamon no suke (Assistant Director of the House Repair and the Cleaning Office)
sen.cmt: He wasを追加しました（文にするため）
sen.e: He was Kamon no suke (Assistant Director of the House Repair and the Cleaning Office)

tit.e: Brief History of the URAGAMI clan
Brief History of the URAGAMI clan
Brief History of the URAGAMI clan

sen.j: 浦上氏は紀長谷雄の子孫（紀貫之の子孫との説もある）で、播磨国揖保郡浦上郷（浦上庄）が苗字の地である。
sen.e: The URAGAMI clan was a descendant of KI no Haseo (there is also a theory indicating that the clan was a descendant of KI no Tsurayuki) and the family name was derived from the area of Uragamigo, Ibo-gun County (Uragamisho), Harima province.

The URAGAMI clan was a descendant of KI no Haseo (there is also a theory indicating that the clan was a descendant of KI no Tsurayuki) and the family name was derived from the area of Uragamigo, Ibo-gun County (Uragamisho), Harima province.

The URAGAMI clan was a descendant of KI no Haseo (there is also a theory indicating that the clan was a descendant of KI no Tsurayuki) and the family name was derived from the area of Uragamigo, Ibo-gun County (Uragamisho), Harima province.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代末期、ここ播磨から赤松則村（円心）が史上に現れると、浦上氏もその麾下として活動した。
sen.e: When Norimura AKAMATSU (Enshin) came into the existence in the history in Harima province, the URAKAMI clan became active under his command in the late Kamakura period.
When Norimura AKAMATSU (Enshin) appeared in the history in Harima province, the Uragami clan became active under his command in the late Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: came into the existance → appearedに変更しました。URAKAMI → Uragami
sen.e: When Norimura AKAMATSU (Enshin) appeared in the history in Harima province, the Uragami clan became active under his command in the late Kamakura period.

sen.j: 鎌倉幕府の倒幕にも参加している。
sen.e: The URAGAMI clan also joined the coup to overthrow the government.
The Uragami clan also joined the coup to overthrow the Kamakura bakufu.
sen.cmt: 鎌倉幕府 Kamakura bakufu 挿入しましたURAGAMI ->Uragami
sen.e: The Uragami clan also joined the coup to overthrow the Kamakura bakufu.

sen.j: その後の南北朝時代 (日本)には、後醍醐天皇を中心とした建武の新政を見限り、早くから足利尊氏に従ったことから室町時代に赤松氏は大きく繁栄した。
sen.e: Later in the Nanbokucho era (the Northern and Southern Courts period) (Japan), the Akamatsu clan greately prospered during the Muromachi period by becoming a follower of Takauji ASHIKAGA from early on after forsaking the Kenmu Restoration which was led by Emperor Godaigo.

Later in the Nanbokucho era (the Northern and Southern Courts period) (Japan), the Akamatsu clan greately prospered during the Muromachi period by becoming a follower of Takauji ASHIKAGA from early on after forsaking the Kenmu Restoration which was led by Emperor Godaigo.

Later in the Nanbokucho era (the Northern and Southern Courts period) (Japan), the Akamatsu clan greately prospered during the Muromachi period by becoming a follower of Takauji ASHIKAGA from early on after forsaking the Kenmu Restoration which was led by Emperor Godaigo.

sen.j: そのなかで浦上氏からも史上に登場する人物が現れた。
sen.e: Historical figures emerged from the URAGAMI clan in this period.
Historical figures emerged from the URAGAMI clan in this period.
Historical figures emerged from the URAGAMI clan in this period.

sen.j: それは『太平記』に名が見える浦上七郎兵衛行景、同五郎左衛門景嗣らである。
sen.e: These figures included Shichirobei Yukikage URAGAMI and Gorozaemon Kagetsugu URAGAMI who appeared in "Taiheiki".
These figures included Shichirobei Yukikage URAGAMI and Gorozaemon Kagetsugu URAGAMI who appeared in "Taiheiki" (Chronicle of Medieval Japan).
sen.cmt: 太平記だけではわからないので、(a Chronicle of Medieval Japan)を追加しました。
sen.e: These figures included Shichirobei Yukikage URAGAMI and Gorozaemon Kagetsugu URAGAMI who appeared in "Taiheiki" (Chronicle of Medieval Japan).

sen.j: しかし室町幕府のもとで飛躍的に勢力を拡大した赤松氏も、足利義教の行った恐怖政治と惣領制への干渉を受け、やがて嘉吉の乱を起こした。
sen.e: However, the AKAMATSU clan who rapidly gained power under Muromachi bakufu was interfered by the Reign of Terror and the Soryo system carried out by Yoshimasa Ashikaga and eventually started the Kakitsu coup because they were influenced by the reign of terror and Soryo system that Yoshimasa Ashikaga prosecuted.

However, the Akamatsu clan which rapidly gained power under Muromachi bakufu was interfered by the Reign of Terror and the Soryo system carried out by Yoshimasa Ashikaga and eventually started the Kakitsu coup.
sen.cmt: was interfered by the Reign of Terror and the Soryo system carried out by Yoshimasa Ashikagainfluenced by the reign of terror and Soryo system that Yoshimasa Ashikaga prosecuted. 句が重複しているためbecause 以下を削除しました。AKAMATSU -> Akamatsu clan
sen.e: However, the Akamatsu clan which rapidly gained power under Muromachi bakufu was interfered by the Reign of Terror and the Soryo system carried out by Yoshimasa Ashikaga and eventually started the Kakitsu coup.

sen.j: これは圧迫に耐えかねた赤松満祐が自邸で将軍義教の暗殺を行うと言う形で起こされたもので、その後京を引き上げた満祐は播磨で抗戦の構えをみせた。
sen.e: This war was occurred because Mitsusuke AKAMATSU, who could not endure this pressure, assisnated Sogun Yoshinori at his residence and later he withdrew from the capital indicating that he would fight back in Harima province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This coup occurred because Mitsusuke AKAMATSU, who could not endure the pressure, assassinated Shogun Yoshinori at his residence and later he withdrew from the capital to fight back in Harima province.
sen.cmt: ミススペルの修正、war→coupに変更（前のParaでcoupになっているのであわせました。Occurredとしました。
sen.e: This coup occurred because Mitsusuke AKAMATSU, who could not endure the pressure, assassinated Shogun Yoshinori at his residence and later he withdrew from the capital to fight back in Harima province.

sen.j: しかし、幕府が動員した守護連合軍に敗れ赤松氏はその勢力を失った。
sen.e: However, he was defeated by the allies of the provincial constable sent by Bakufu and the Akamatsu clan lost their power.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, he was defeated by the allies of the provincial constable sent by Bakufu and the Akamatsu clan lost their power.
However, he was defeated by the allies of the provincial constable sent by Bakufu and the Akamatsu clan lost their power.

sen.j: しかし、浦上氏ら赤松氏の遺臣たちは満祐の弟赤松義雅の孫赤松政則をもりたてて、主家再興を企画し成功させる。
sen.e: However, the remaining AKAMATSU clans such as the URAGAMI clan suported Masanori AKAMATSU, a grand son of Yoshimasa AKAMATSU who was a younger brother of Mitsusuke, and succeeded to restore the head family's line.

However, the surviving retainers of the Akamatsu clan such as the Uragami clan supported Masanori AKAMATSU, a grand son of Yoshimasa AKAMATSU who was a younger brother of Mitsusuke, and succeeded to restore the head family's line.
sen.cmt: 遺臣→remaining clan をsurviving retainersにしました。AKAMATSU clan URAGAMI clan -> Akamatsu clan, Uragami clan
sen.e: However, the surviving retainers of the Akamatsu clan such as the Uragami clan supported Masanori AKAMATSU, a grand son of Yoshimasa AKAMATSU who was a younger brother of Mitsusuke, and succeeded to restore the head family's line.

sen.j: その主家再興に活躍した名臣浦上則宗の元で赤松氏と浦上氏は勢力を大きく伸ばした。
sen.e: The Akamatsu clan and URAGANI clan greately extended their power under the supervision of the eminent politician, Norimune URAGAMI who contributed for the restoration of the head family.
The Akamatsu clan and URAGANI clan greatly extended their power under the supervision of the eminent politician, Norimune URAGAMI who contributed to the restoration of the head family.
sen.cmt: contributed for → contributed toに変更しました。
sen.e: The Akamatsu clan and URAGANI clan greatly extended their power under the supervision of the eminent politician, Norimune URAGAMI who contributed to the restoration of the head family.

sen.j: 赤松氏は応仁の乱では東軍（主将細川勝元）に加わった。
sen.e: The Akamatsu clan joined the Eastern squad (led by the captain Katsumoto HOSOKAWA) during the Onin War.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Akamatsu clan joined the Eastern squad (led by the captain Katsumoto HOSOKAWA) during the Onin War.
The Akamatsu clan joined the Eastern squad (led by the captain Katsumoto HOSOKAWA) during the Onin War.

sen.j: 則宗は勢力基盤である播磨周囲の伯耆国・因幡国などの西軍山名氏の領国で、さらには洛中で赤松軍を率いる主将として活躍した。
sen.e: Norimune took an active role as the captain who led the AKAMATSU squad in the territory of the YAMANA clan of the Western squad such as in Hoki province and Inaba no kuni in the vicinity of Harima province and, moreover, in Rakuchu (inside the capital).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Norimune took an active role as the captain who led the Akamatsu squad in the territory of the Yamana clan of the Western squad such as in Hoki province and Inaba no kuni in the vicinity of Harima province and, moreover, in Rakuchu (inside the capital).

Norimune took an active role as the captain who led the Akamatsu squad in the territory of the Yamana clan of the Western squad such as in Hoki province and Inaba no kuni in the vicinity of Harima province and, moreover, in Rakuchu (inside the capital).

sen.j: そのため応仁の乱の後、赤松政則が侍所の所司に任ぜられると、則宗が侍所室町幕府となり実務を司った。
sen.e: Therefore, Norimune became a member of Samurai-dokoro (the Board of Retainers) for the Muromachi Bakufu (Shogunate) and handled practical business affairs when Masanori AKAMATSU was assigned as a Shoshi (an officer) of Samurai-dokoro (the Board of Retainers) after Onin War.

Therefore, Norimune became a member of Samurai-dokoro (the Board of Retainers) for the Muromachi Bakufu (Shogunate) and handled practical business affairs when Masanori AKAMATSU was assigned as a Shoshi (an officer) of Samurai-dokoro (the Board of Retainers) after Onin War.

Therefore, Norimune became a member of Samurai-dokoro (the Board of Retainers) for the Muromachi Bakufu (Shogunate) and handled practical business affairs when Masanori AKAMATSU was assigned as a Shoshi (an officer) of Samurai-dokoro (the Board of Retainers) after Onin War.

sen.j: 浦上氏は全盛期を迎えようとしていた。
sen.e: The URAGAMI clan was waiting for the era at the height of its prosperity.
The Uragami clan started to enjoy the height of its prosperity.
sen.cmt: 迎えようとしていた was waiting forの直訳をstarted to enjoyに変更しました（自然な表現にするため）
sen.e: The Uragami clan started to enjoy the height of its prosperity.

sen.j: 則宗の養嗣子である浦上祐宗の跡を継いで浦上氏の当主になったと見られるものの、肝心の家督相続の経緯、時期については永正年間前半の祐宗、村宗の動向を示す史料が少ない為、はっきりしない。
sen.e: The process of how and timing of when Muramune succeeded to the family headship are not clear because the historical materials about the movement of Sukemune and Muramune in the beginning of the Eisho period is lacking although Muramune is thought to become a head of the URAGAMI clan by succeeding Sukemune URAGAMI, an addopted heir of Norimune,
sen.cmt: 祐宗は、すけむねとしました。
sen.e: The process of how and when Muramune succeeded to the family headship is not clear because there were few historical materials about the movement of Sukemune and Muramune in the beginning of the Eisho era, although Muramune is thought to become a head of the Uragami clan by succeeding Sukemune URAGAMI, an adopted heir of Norimune,
sen.cmt: timing of whentiming of を削除しましたis lacking をfew に変更しました（自然な表現）period → era
sen.e: The process of how and when Muramune succeeded to the family headship is not clear because there were few historical materials about the movement of Sukemune and Muramune in the beginning of the Eisho era, although Muramune is thought to become a head of the Uragami clan by succeeding Sukemune URAGAMI, an adopted heir of Norimune,

sen.j: そもそも、浦上家中における村宗の立場についても判明していない。
sen.e: Furthermore, the status of Muramune in the URAGAMI family is not clear.
Furthermore, the status of Muramune in the Uragami family is not clear.
Furthermore, the status of Muramune in the Uragami family is not clear.

sen.j: 則宗、浦上則景、祐宗らの養子として系図を繋げる文献もあるが、証拠と裏付けられるだけの史料は無い。
sen.e: Although there is a genealogy indicating Muramune as an adopted child of Norimune, Norikage URAGAMI, or Sukemune, there is no historical materials which support that genealogy.
Although there is a genealogy indicating Muramune as an adopted child of Norimune, Norikage URAGAMI, or Sukemune, there is no historical materials which support that genealogy.
Although there is a genealogy indicating Muramune as an adopted child of Norimune, Norikage URAGAMI, or Sukemune, there is no historical materials which support that genealogy.

sen.j: それに元々浦上氏の嫡流であった浦上則永の孫に当たるので則宗の子、養子が悉く死んだ後ならば誰の養子にならずとも相続の順が回って来たとしても不思議ではない為、これらの系図の信憑性には疑問が残る。
sen.e: Furthermore, there is a question about the credibility of the genealogy since Muramune was eventually able to succeed the family headship without being adopted by somebody because Muramune was a child of Norimune who was a grandchild of Norinaga URAGAMI, the direct descendant of the URAGAMI clan.

Furthermore, there is a question about the credibility of the genealogy since Muramune was eventually able to succeed the family headship without being adopted by somebody because Muramune was a child of Norimune who was a grandchild of Norinaga URAGAMI, the direct descendant of the Uragami clan.
sen.cmt: 表記修正 URAGAMI clan →Uragami clan
sen.e: Furthermore, there is a question about the credibility of the genealogy since Muramune was eventually able to succeed the family headship without being adopted by somebody because Muramune was a child of Norimune who was a grandchild of Norinaga URAGAMI, the direct descendant of the Uragami clan.

sen.j: 主家との暗闘
sen.e: The tacit fight against the master
The tacit fight against the master
The tacit fight against the master

sen.j: 主家では赤松政則の死後、その養子である赤松義村が幼年であったこともあり、政則後室である洞松院の後見や、浦上氏などの支持を受ける形で、播磨・備前国・美作国の守護職に就いた。
sen.e: At the master family, Muramune became a guardian of Toshoin, a dowager of Masanori, and a Shugoshoku (a military officer) of Harima, Bizen, and Mimasaku Provinces after the death of Masanori AKAMATSU by the support from the URAGAMI clan since Yoshimura AKAMATSU, an adopted child of Masanori AKAMATSU, was still a small child.

After the death of Masanori AKAMATSU at the master family, Muramune became Shugoshoku (a military officer) of Harima, Bizen, and Mimasaku Provinces with the support of Toshoin, a dowager of Masanori, as well as Uragami clan because Yoshimura AKAMATSU, an adopted son of Masanori AKAMATSU, was still a small child.
sen.cmt: 原文解釈の変更：「後見や」：後見人になったのではなく、後見（推薦）を受けてと解釈しました（子どもではなく未亡人の後見人になるのは不自然）
sen.e: After the death of Masanori AKAMATSU at the master family, Muramune became Shugoshoku (a military officer) of Harima, Bizen, and Mimasaku Provinces with the support of Toshoin, a dowager of Masanori, as well as Uragami clan because Yoshimura AKAMATSU, an adopted son of Masanori AKAMATSU, was still a small child.

sen.j: その後、義村は成長するにつれ、大きく勢力を伸張させた守護代 浦上氏に惧れを抱き、また自立の機会を窺っていた。
sen.e: Later, as Yoshimura became older, he feared the URAGAMI clan who greately increased the influence and also waited the chance to become independent.
Later, as Yoshimura became older, he feared the Uragami clan who greatly increased the influence and also waited for the chance to become independent.
sen.cmt: スペルミス修正しました。waited for に変更しました。
sen.e: Later, as Yoshimura became older, he feared the Uragami clan who greatly increased the influence and also waited for the chance to become independent.

sen.j: 永正14年（1517年）、この頃よりようやく政務に参加するようになった義村は、2人の宿老（浦上村宗、小寺則職）と義村の3人の側近（櫛橋則高・志水清実・衣笠朝親）から構成される新体制を布く。
sen.e: Yoshimura finally became mature enough to join the politics around 1517 and established the new political system managed by two chief vassals (Muramune URAGAMI and Norimoto KODERA) and three of Yoshimura's close advisers (Noritaka KUSHIBASHI, 志水清実・衣笠朝親).
sen.cmt: 志水清実・衣笠朝親の読み方がわかりません。
sen.e: Yoshimura finally became mature enough to join the politics around 1517 and established the new political system managed by two chief vassals (Muramune URAGAMI and Norimoto KODERA) and three of Yoshimura's close advisers (Noritaka KUSHIBASHI, 志水清実・衣笠朝親).

Yoshimura finally became mature enough to join the politics around 1517 and established the new political system managed by two chief vassals (Muramune URAGAMI and Norimoto KODERA) and three of Yoshimura's close advisers (Noritaka KUSHIBASHI, 志水清実・衣笠朝親).

sen.j: しかし、この新体制は 「宿老の専横抑制と義村自身の発言力の強化」 を狙う意図が見え透いていたため、村宗は義村に反発した。
sen.e: However, it was not difficult to suspect the true purpose of this new political system which was to "enforce the suppression of a tyranny by chief vassals and the influence of Yoshimura"; therefore, Muramune opposed to Yoshimura.

However, it was not difficult to suspect the true purpose of this new political system which was to "enforce the suppression of a tyranny by chief vassals and the influence of Yoshimura"; therefore, Muramune opposed to Yoshimura.

However, it was not difficult to suspect the true purpose of this new political system which was to "enforce the suppression of a tyranny by chief vassals and the influence of Yoshimura"; therefore, Muramune opposed to Yoshimura.

sen.j: さらにもう一人の宿老である則職とも対立してしまう。
sen.e: This conflict caused him to oppose to the other chief vassals, Norimoto.
This conflict caused him to oppose to the other chief vassals, Norimoto.
This conflict caused him to oppose to the other chief vassals, Norimoto.

sen.j: これにより則職や3人の宿老による讒言で立場を悪くした上に、これを重んじた義村によって、出仕差し止めという仕置きを下されてしまった。
sen.e: As a result, Muramune fell into a predicament due to the false charge by Norimoto and three close advisers and was ordered to stop from serving at government office.
sen.cmt: 3人の宿老とありますが、側近だと思われます。
sen.e: As a result, Muramune fell into a predicament due to the false charge by Norimoto and three close advisers and was ordered to stop from serving at government office.
As a result, Muramune fell into a predicament due to the false charge by Norimoto and three close advisers and was ordered to stop from serving at government office.

sen.j: 武力闘争に発展
sen.e: Developing to the military fight
Developing to the military fight
Developing to the military fight

sen.j: このように、あからさまな赤松氏の権力機構からの排斥行為に怒った村宗は、宇喜多能家などの家臣らと共に備前へと帰り、三石城に籠もって赤松氏への反旗を翻した。
sen.e: Raged Muramune, who was tactlessly excluded from the position in governmental office by the Akamatsu clan, returned to Bizen Province with vassals including Yoshiie UKITA and secluded himself in the Mitsuishi-jo Castle to revolt against the Akamatsu clan.

Raged Muramune, who was tactlessly excluded from the position in governmental office by the Akamatsu clan, returned to Bizen Province with vassals including Yoshiie UKITA and secluded himself in the Mitsuishi-jo Castle to revolt against the Akamatsu clan.

Raged Muramune, who was tactlessly excluded from the position in governmental office by the Akamatsu clan, returned to Bizen Province with vassals including Yoshiie UKITA and secluded himself in the Mitsuishi-jo Castle to revolt against the Akamatsu clan.
Winter of 1519
Winter of 1519
Winter of 1519

sen.j: この謀反を、自身の更なる権力強化の好機ととらえて討伐軍を動員した義村によって、三石城を取り囲まれた。
sen.e: Muramune secluded in Mitsuishi-jo was surrounded by a punitive force lead by Yoshimura who thought that the revolt by Muramune was the opportunity to further strengthen his power.
Muramune secluded in Mitsuishi-jo was surrounded by a punitive force lead by Yoshimura who thought that the revolt by Muramune was the opportunity to further strengthen his power.
Muramune secluded in Mitsuishi-jo was surrounded by a punitive force lead by Yoshimura who thought that the revolt by Muramune was the opportunity to further strengthen his power.

sen.j: しかし、村宗も赤松氏と敵対関係にあった備前の最大国人 松田元陸と密かに結ぶなど対策を講じていた。
sen.e: However, Muramune secretly tied with Motomichi TATSUDA, the most powerful man in Bizen Province, who had an antagonistic relationship with the Akamatsu clan.
sen.cmt: 最大国人の意味がわかりません。
sen.e: However, Muramune secretly tied with Motomichi MATSUDA, the most powerful man in Bizen Province, who had an antagonistic relationship with the Akamatsu clan.
However, Muramune secretly tied with Motomichi MATSUDA, the most powerful man in Bizen Province, who had an antagonistic relationship with the Akamatsu clan.

sen.j: 結局、要害の地に築かれた三石城の堅い守りを攻めあぐねた義村は、後詰めに元陸が現れるとの報にやむなく兵を退く。
sen.e: Yoshimune, who was struggling during the attack of the impregnable Mitsuishi-jo due to the tight defence, withdrew his troops when he saw the rear guard led by Motomichi.
Yoshimura, who was struggling during the attack of the impregnable Mitsuishi-jo due to the tight defence, withdrew his troops when he saw the rear guard led by Motomichi.
Yoshimura, who was struggling during the attack of the impregnable Mitsuishi-jo due to the tight defence, withdrew his troops when he saw the rear guard led by Motomichi.

sen.j: しかし翌年の永正17年（1520年）にも再度、討伐軍（義村自身の出征ではなく、小寺城主 小寺則職を主将）が動員される。
sen.e: However, in the following year, 1520, Yoshimura re-sent a punitive force (led by Norimoto KODERA who was the lord of Kodera-jo Castle, not by Yoshimura himself).
However, in the following year, 1520, Yoshimura re-sent a punitive force (led by Norimoto KODERA who was the lord of Kodera-jo Castle, not by Yoshimura himself).
However, in the following year, 1520, Yoshimura re-sent a punitive force (led by Norimoto KODERA who was the lord of Kodera-jo Castle, not by Yoshimura himself).

sen.j: この時の征伐軍は浦上氏の本拠への攻撃よりも、浦上派へ転身した美作国守護代の中村則久など浦上派の諸城への攻撃で、弱体化を図っている。
sen.e: The punitive force at the time planned to weaken the URAGAMI clan by attacking castles belonging to the URAGAMI sect such as Norihisa Nakamura who was the military governor of Mimasaka province and turned to be the URAGAMI clan.

The punitive force at the time planned to weaken the Uragami clan by attacking castles belonging to the Uragami sect such as Norihisa Nakamura who was the military governor of Mimasaka province and turned to be the Uragami clan.

The punitive force at the time planned to weaken the Uragami clan by attacking castles belonging to the Uragami sect such as Norihisa Nakamura who was the military governor of Mimasaka province and turned to be the Uragami clan.

sen.j: 浦上勢を圧倒する討伐軍は、義村の目的を達成するかに思えた。
sen.e: The punitive force which overwhelmed the URAGAMI force was believed to accomplish Yoshimura's plan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The punitive force which overwhelmed the Uragami force was believed to accomplish Yoshimura's plan.
The punitive force which overwhelmed the Uragami force was believed to accomplish Yoshimura's plan.

sen.j: しかし、浦上の子飼いである能家らの頑強な抵抗に遭い、征伐に手間取る。
sen.e: However, the punitive force suffered a strong resistance from retainers of the URAGAMI causing the punitive force to struggle.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, the punitive force suffered a strong resistance from retainers of the URAGAMI causing the punitive force to struggle.
However, the punitive force suffered a strong resistance from retainers of the URAGAMI causing the punitive force to struggle.

sen.j: やがて、調略の手を伸ばすなど討伐軍への揺さぶりをかけた守勢の村宗によって、小寺則職率いる討伐軍は撃退されてしまう。
sen.e: Muramune who was defending his force by
Muramune, who was defensive initially, rattled the punitive force by seeking betrayers among them and so on, and finally defeated the punitive force led by Norimoto KODERA.
sen.cmt: ほとんど訳抜けでした
sen.e: Muramune, who was defensive initially, rattled the punitive force by seeking betrayers among them and so on, and finally defeated the punitive force led by Norimoto KODERA.

sen.j: その結果、義村の勢力は大きく損なわれ、逆に村宗は播磨に攻め入った。
sen.e: As a result, the Yoshimura's force was greatly impaired, contrary to the Muramune's force which moved on to attack Harima province.
As a result, the Yoshimura's force was greatly impaired, contrary to the Muramune's force which moved on to attack Harima province.
As a result, the Yoshimura's force was greatly impaired, contrary to the Muramune's force which moved on to attack Harima province.

sen.j: これで優勢となった村宗は義村に迫ると、同年11月には義村から嫡子 才松丸を引き渡させた上に、強制隠居に追い込んだ。
sen.e: Muramune, who became superior to Yoshimura, pressed Yoshimura to hand over his legitimate child, Saimatsumaru, and; moreover, forced him to retire.
sen.cmt: 才松丸の読み方がわかりません。
sen.e: Muramune, who became superior to Yoshimura, pressed Yoshimura to hand over his legitimate child Saimatsumaru and moreover forced him to retire.
sen.cmt: セミコロン削除しました
sen.e: Muramune, who became superior to Yoshimura, pressed Yoshimura to hand over his legitimate child Saimatsumaru and moreover forced him to retire.

sen.j: その後、当時8歳の才松丸を改め赤松晴政に赤松氏の家督を継がせると、村宗は自らこの後見人となった。
sen.e: Later, Muramune forced Harumasa AKAMATSU, Saimatsumaru's new name, to succeed the Akamatsu clan and made himself to be his guardian.
Later, Muramune made 8-year old Harumasa AKAMATSU (Saimatsumaru's new name) to succeed the Akamatsu clan and became his guardian.
sen.cmt: 8歳 訳抜けに対応しました。
sen.e: Later, Muramune made 8-year old Harumasa AKAMATSU (Saimatsumaru's new name) to succeed the Akamatsu clan and became his guardian.

sen.j: 翌永正18年（1521年）の正月、足利義晴を奉じて義村がまたも兵を挙げるがこれを破った。
sen.e: Yoshimura again gathered troops for the reason to embrace Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA, but was defeated by Muramune during New Year's holidays of 1521.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Yoshimura again gathered troops with Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA as figurehead, but was defeated by Muramune during New Year of 1521.
sen.cmt: New year holidays → holidayを削除しました奉ずる embraceはこの場合不適なため、with Yoshiharu as figureheadと意訳しました。
sen.e: Yoshimura again gathered troops with Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA as figurehead, but was defeated by Muramune during New Year of 1521.

sen.j: 義晴の確保を目論む村宗は義村に嘘の和睦を持ちかけ、これに応じた義村を和解の席で捕縛した。
sen.e: Muramune, who was trying to secure Yoshiharu, proposed false reconciliation to Yoshimura and arrested him at the meeting when Yoshimura came to reconcilliate.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Muramune, who was trying to secure Yoshiharu, proposed false reconciliation to Yoshimura and arrested him at the meeting when Yoshimura came to reconcilliate.
Muramune, who was trying to secure Yoshiharu, proposed false reconciliation to Yoshimura and arrested him at the meeting when Yoshimura came to reconcilliate.

sen.j: 捕らえた義村を播磨の室津に幽閉し、元号が大永に変わった同年9月には刺客に義村を暗殺させた。
sen.e: Muramune confined Yoshimura at Murotsu in Harima province and sent an assassin to kill him in September of Daiei era.
Muramune confined Yoshimura at Murotsu in Harima province and sent an assassin to kill him in September of Daiei era.
Muramune confined Yoshimura at Murotsu in Harima province and sent an assassin to kill him in September of Daiei era.

sen.j: その頃、義晴は細川高国に預けられて上洛を果たし、征夷大将軍となっている。
sen.e: Around that time, Yoshiharu transfered to the capital with Takakuni Hosokawa and became Seii Taishougun (a commandar-in-chief of the expeditionary force against the barbarians).
Around that time, Yoshiharu was in the custody of Takakuni Hosokawa and proceeded to the capital to become Seii Taishougun (a commander-in-chief of the expeditionary force against the barbarians).
sen.cmt: 預けられて が訳出されていなかったので in the custody of を挿入しました
sen.e: Around that time, Yoshiharu was in the custody of Takakuni Hosokawa and proceeded to the capital to become Seii Taishougun (a commander-in-chief of the expeditionary force against the barbarians).

sen.j: これにより名目的にも実質的にも、播磨・備前・美作の支配権を得て戦国大名への道を歩み始めた。
sen.e: By this event, Muramune, both nominally and practically, was beginning to become the Sengoku Daimyo (a Warrying lord) after gaining a right to rule Harima, Bizen, and Mimasaka Provinves.
By this event, Muramune, both nominally and practically, started on the path to the Sengoku Daimyo (a Warring lord) after gaining a right to rule Harima, Bizen, and Mimasaka Provinces.
sen.cmt: 表現の変更 道を歩み始めた started on the path toWarring としました。
sen.e: By this event, Muramune, both nominally and practically, started on the path to the Sengoku Daimyo (a Warring lord) after gaining a right to rule Harima, Bizen, and Mimasaka Provinces.

sen.j: ただし浦上氏の赤松氏に対する下克上は、他家のそれと比較すると比較的穏和なものであり、但馬国の山名誠豊が播磨へ侵攻してきた際は、赤松氏と共闘してもいる。
sen.e: However, gekokujo (the revolt of vassals against their lords) of the URAGAMI clan against the Akamatsu clan was relatively less strict compared with that by other clans and the URAGAMI clan fought together with the Akamatsu clan when Nobutoyo YAMANA from Tajima province invaded Harima province.

However, gekokujo (the revolt of vassals against their lords) of the Uragami clan against the Akamatsu clan was relatively less strict compared with that by other clans and the Uragami clan fought together with the Akamatsu clan when Nobutoyo YAMANA from Tajima province invaded Harima province.

However, gekokujo (the revolt of vassals against their lords) of the Uragami clan against the Akamatsu clan was relatively less strict compared with that by other clans and the Uragami clan fought together with the Akamatsu clan when Nobutoyo YAMANA from Tajima province invaded Harima province.

sen.j: 山名氏の脅威が去った後は、赤松氏との覇権を巡る争いを再開し、浦上村国など一族の有力者と争いつつ、政村を置塩城より追放し、美作国へ追いやったこともある。
sen.e: After the threat from the YAMANA clan was gone, Muramune re-started a feud with the Akamatsu clan over the supremacy and forced Masamura to Mimasaka province from Okishio-jo Castle while fighting with influencial families such as the family from Uragamimura province.

After the threat from the YAMANA clan was gone, Muramune re-started a feud with the Akamatsu clan over the supremacy and forced Masamura from Okishio-jo Castle to Mimasaka province while fighting with influential families of the Uragami clan such as Murakuni URAGAMI.
sen.cmt: 解釈ミス 浦上村国は人名です
sen.e: After the threat from the YAMANA clan was gone, Muramune re-started a feud with the Akamatsu clan over the supremacy and forced Masamura from Okishio-jo Castle to Mimasaka province while fighting with influential families of the Uragami clan such as Murakuni URAGAMI.

sen.j: 野心の果てに
sen.e: The end of ambition
The end of ambition
The end of ambition

sen.j: 力をつけた村宗は、細川晴元と対立し京を追われた管領 細川高国の依頼を受け、主君 政村と一時和睦した上で上洛の軍を起こし、細川氏の家督争いへ介入するようになる。
sen.e: Empowered Muramune accepted the request from Takakuni HOSOKAWA, who was ousted from the capital due to the conflict with Harumoto HOSOKAWA, and became involved in the succession dispute of the HOSOKAWA clan by forming the military force to go to the capital after temporary reconciling with the Lord Masamura.

Empowered Muramune accepted the request from Takakuni HOSOKAWA, who was ousted from the capital due to the conflict with Harumoto HOSOKAWA, and became involved in the succession dispute of the Hosokawa clan by forming the military force to go to the capital after temporary reconciling with the Lord Masamura.

Empowered Muramune accepted the request from Takakuni HOSOKAWA, who was ousted from the capital due to the conflict with Harumoto HOSOKAWA, and became involved in the succession dispute of the Hosokawa clan by forming the military force to go to the capital after temporary reconciling with the Lord Masamura.

sen.j: 当初は、晴元派の重鎮である柳本賢治や東播磨で村宗と対立してきた別所就治を破るなど破竹の勢いで進撃した。
sen.e: At the time, Muramune advanced and attacked resulting in the defeat of Kataharu Yanagimoto who was a leader of the Harumoto party and Nariharu BESSHO who opposed to Muramune in Higashiharima.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Initially Muramune advanced unopposed by defeating Kataharu YANAGIMOTO who was a leader of the Harumoto party and Nariharu BESSHO who opposed to Muramune in Higashiharima.
sen.cmt: 破竹の勢いで unopposedを訳出しましたKataharu YANAGIMOTOとしました。
sen.e: Initially Muramune advanced unopposed by defeating Kataharu YANAGIMOTO who was a leader of the Harumoto party and Nariharu BESSHO who opposed to Muramune in Higashiharima.

sen.j: 享禄4年（1531年）6月、中嶋の戦い・大物崩れで晴元や三好元長に敗北しただけでなく、討死してしまう。
sen.e: Muramune was defeated by Harumoto and Motonaga Miyoshi and killed in the Battle of Nakajima and Daimotsu-kuzure.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Muramune was defeated by Harumoto and Motonaga MIYOSHI and killed in the Battle of Nakajima and Daimotsu-kuzure, which resulted in his death.
Muramune was defeated by Harumoto and Motonaga MIYOSHI and killed in the Battle of Nakajima and Daimotsu-kuzure, which resulted in his death.

sen.j: なお、この勝敗の帰趨を決したのは、後詰めであったはずの政祐（政村）が、晴元・元長らと対峙する高国・浦上軍を背後から攻撃したことであった。
sen.e: Furthermore, the outcome of this fight was owed to Masasuke (Masamura) because he attacked the Takakuni and Uragami military forces who were confronting with Harumoto and Motonaga from behind, although he was supposed to be a rear guard.

Furthermore, the outcome of this fight was owed to Masasuke (Masamura) because he attacked the Takakuni and Uragami military forces, which were confronting with Harumoto and Motonaga, from behind, although he was supposed to be a rear guard.
sen.cmt: who を whichに変更しました。
sen.e: Furthermore, the outcome of this fight was owed to Masasuke (Masamura) because he attacked the Takakuni and Uragami military forces, which were confronting with Harumoto and Motonaga, from behind, although he was supposed to be a rear guard.

sen.j: 政祐のこの行動は、父の無念を晴らし、かつ守護としての実権を取り戻すためと説明されることが多い。
sen.e: This Masasuke's action was often explained as being an act of revenge and to regain power as Shugo (a provincial constable).
This Masasuke's action was often explained as being an act of revenge and to regain power as Shugo (a provincial constable).
This Masasuke's action was often explained as being an act of revenge and to regain power as Shugo (a provincial constable).

sen.j: 村宗の死後、家督は嫡男 虎満丸（後の政宗）に継がれた。
sen.e: After the death of Muramune, reigns of the family was succeeded to Toramitsumaru (later called as Masamune), a legitimate son.
After the death of Muramune, reigns of the family was succeeded to Toramitsumaru (later called as Masamune), a legitimate son.
After the death of Muramune, reigns of the family was succeeded to Toramitsumaru (later called as Masamune), a legitimate son.
